review: ä¸å¦‚å»ç©ä¸€å¨å±ï¼Œå±è¿˜æœ‰äººæ‹‰ï¼Œå®ˆæœ›2åˆ«è¯´æµ®æœ¨ï¼Œå°±æ˜¯å‡ æŠŠæ¯›éƒ½æ²¡æœ‰ï¼Œæ¥è¿™é‡Œçš„è’¸æ‰¹èµ¶ç´§åˆ·å·®è¯„ä¸ç„¶æˆ‘å°±å»ä¸‰å›½æ€åˆ·å¥½è¯„ï¼Œè¿˜æœ‰è€ƒè¿ªå…‹ï¼Œåˆ«è®©æˆ‘åœ¨äº’è”ç½‘çœ‹è§ä½ ï¼Œçœ‹è§ä½ æˆ‘å¿…é¡»ç»™ä½ å¤´å¥—è–…æ‰å¿…é¡»æ‰“ä½ è„¸ï¼Œä½ å¦ˆä¹Ÿéš¾é€ƒä¸€æ­»ï¼Œæ˜¨å¤©ä½ æ“ä½ å¦ˆå¤ªç‹ ï¼Œä»Šå¤©ä½ å¦ˆåœ¨å¤§è¡—ä¸Šç´«è–‡ç»™æ‰¹æ‰£ç¯®äº†ï¼Œæ»‹æ»‹å†’è¡€ï¼Œè¿˜çœ‹ä½ å¦ˆç©å®¶è¯„ä»·å‘¢ï¼Œèµ¶ç´§å»ç»™ä½ å¤§é©¬è·¯ä¸Šçš„ä½ å¦ˆçŸ³å—æ‰«èµ·æ¥ï¼Œå‰ä¸å‰ä¸ç»™ä½ å†…è¯å¨˜é»‘äººç¢ŸçŒåœ¨ç›´è‚ é‡Œ

I never review anything but I figured I might as well give my two cents why this game and the company behind it are absolute trash and have betrayed me not only here but in another blizzard related game as well but first a disclaimer.
[b]I give not a single rats ass about the PVE It was never good and I dont even like Tf2s PVE either or the communities focused around it.[/b]

[b]-[/b] Firstly when the release of Overwatch originally happened it was a good time, fun times were had but I noticed sometime after the shift in the games atmosphere and focus shifted pretty heavily, it became more competitive focused starting with the removal of of multiheros from casual and shit only got worse from there, it got so bad that the community itself started morphing and catering to the type of clowns that still play league of Legend whos reputation is that of a whiny crying passive aggressive baby who cant hold L's to save their lives. I literally watched casual turn into Wienie Hut jr for competitive asshats instead of being a game where I can sit down and kill a couple peeps and relax unlike a certain game whos the precursor of Overwatch and its sequel and its still a good time. The last straw for me personally when it came to the community was when I watched our widowmaker get angry at a winston for spamming his voicelines and threaten to report him for it to which I and the team told him "shut up you're an idiot" at which then he piped down for the remainder of the game (we won) but not long after Blizzard instated a limit to speech spam I could see which way this shitstorm was blowing because I once saw LoL devolve to such shit and lo and behold it came to pass complete with role que. Enough though about how blizzard basically fostered a toxic community by design and choice, lets talk about why the game actually fucking sucks.

[b]-[/b] Lack of depth or removal of depth to characters and mechanics some of the characters in this game feel like their missing things like some of the things you watch Overwatch characters do in cutscenes are actually full of shit or dont exist ingame, like to give an example The shimada brothers are capable of literally jumping up and down left right on walls in these cutscenes but they can only run up walls in game thats some bullshit or how D.va actually have full hover and flight in the animation, Roadhog literally having another weapon on his back that he never uses and now recently Doomfist not being able to uppercut anymore even though all you would need to do is make it like Baptise where if you crouch and then hit space it gives you a higher jump but instead this high jump is also an attack Blizzard is Wholly afraid of being too creative with their character kits that its kinda annoying that they create these characters around Meta shit instead around being fun which now leads into the BIGGEST reason why this game sucks ass now

[b]-[/b] Game balance is absolutely trash and it got even worse when they removed a player slot now we got a few characters that are fundamentally not even working correctly because they were balanced around having another fuckin tank but the reality is that Overwatch Balance fundamentally doesnt fucking work because its a System meant for MMORPGS and last time i checked overwatch is a PVP oriented game they really need to ditch it because all it does is limit them what they can do with the game and the characters in it.

[b]-[/b]Removal of features and or maps this is a pretty clear cut case lets be real here.

[b]-[/b]Monitization is absolutely abhorrent I played this game at its original release and looking at what they're doing to the F2P is fucking batshit, League wasnt a good game when I got done with it but atleast they let their players earn their currency through games I cant believe Iam praising riot of all things for being more consumer friendly ffs.

[b]-[/b]Lack of content there is no reason why this new and shiny game should not have more content then it does now blizzards mismanagement and troubles have affected this game so much.

[b]-[/b] Blizzard themselves are the biggest fartsniffers on this earth I dont give a shit about no legality's or anything but damn if it doesnt make them look hypocritical when I see all these politcally charged shit in my videogames while mr kotick  basically steals the very souls of his employees(and maybe one or two babies) Ive seen their arrogance first hand when I was still playing world of warcraft and needless to say they fucking pissed me off they do not listen to feed back or criticism or otherwise untill now that their backs are against the wall and even then people are still getting resistance.

Pretty much basically save your time and effort because Blizzard is not worth supporting not until they finally get the message.
this game just wants your money. thats it.

As a Valorant player I can say that this game is so much better. Probably one of the best fps's right now, the only downside being blizzard currently being insanely greedy, but it's not like that's unheard of in other games. Undelivered promises aside it's still a great game.

This game is modern day game development atrocity. Only valid reason for this to be "2" not just patch to Overwatch 1 was adding large PvE element with progression, which in the end was never delivered. The rest, with main thing being disabling Overwatch 1 (you could say that Overwatch 1 is wiped from existence), is just for one reason: make money with low development effort.

I recommend signing petition to bring Overwatch 1 back online (game which suffered from realease of '2' by two years of content creation negligence) and jest delete this.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Disclaimer: I have played over 700 hours of this game since its release in 2016 (for some reason steam shows I've only played 5 mins)

TLDR: The gameplay isn't bad, although the experience is a major downgrade from the original. The company making the game is a soulless, disgusting, and greedy monstrosity that doesn't deserve a single penny from the player base. So play the game if you want, but don't give these greedy bastards a single cent.

If I were to compare this game to a restaurant experience it would go something like this: "You gaze up on a building whose hay day has long passed. As you enter you see the owner assaulting and beating a waitress. He pauses for but a moment to point you to the restaurant's gift shop. The stuff they sell is nothing special, but the prices make you want to gouge your eyes out. You then proceed to your table, which hasn't been cleaned in years. You point this out to an employee. They smile and proceed to clean the table by spitting on it and wiping it off with their shirt. You order the food and it arrives in a reasonable amount of time, however, your cutlery and chipped plate have food stains on them. You also saw the owner wiping his nose with your napkin earlier. The food itself is pretty great though. You tell the owner you aren't paying for the meal because your experience was horrible. The owner smiles and tells you: "This is a free restaurant. You don't have to pay." He then spits in your face, punches you, and says he hopes you come back for more next time."

Now, onto the review:
Overwatch 1 was great. It had balance and toxicity issues, but overall the 40 EUR bought me hundreds of hours of fun. I even met some great people who I am friends with to this day.

Overwatch 2 is a disgusting cash grab that completely diminishes any sense of reward from playing the game.

"Free to play":
At launch, my collective OW1 inventory would have cost a new OW2 player over 2000 EUR. I head well over 100 legendary skins, around 30 on just my 3 main heroes (out of 38 total heroes in the game as of writing this), with each costing 19 EUR on launch. These prices were recently reduced to 15 EUR for skins from events and 1000 in-game credits for old and mostly crappy non-event skins. The only money I ever spent on Overwatch 1 was 40 EUR for the game itself, 15 EUR for the breast cancer charity Mercy skin, and 20 EUR for Atlantic Allstars 2019 skins. Overall 75 EUR I don't regret spending. I had the vast majority of all cosmetic items in the game without ever spending a single cent on loot boxes. The only way to get cosmetics now is to buy a 10 EUR battle pass every few months or just outright buying skins from the shop.

Speaking of credits, I had about 6000 in-game credits in OW1. That was enough to buy 6 non-event legendary skins or 2 event legendary skins. I didn't spend them tho, since I had all the skins I liked. Upon release of OW2, those 2-6 skins worth of credits were turned into 140 premium coins. That was less than a 10th of a legendary skin in OW2.

A second important note in this section is that in Overwatch 1 the devs promised that all current and future heroes would be free and would be unlocked for every player when they bought the game. Now we are at a point where the cost of newly released heroes is higher than the original game price. There is a way to unlock them for free but it takes about 18 hours per hero as you need to get 35 wins qued as the role of the character (50% win rate means about 70 games that last an average of 15 minutes)
Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑŒ ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¶Ñ€Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°ÑÑŒ Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ Ğ³ĞµĞ¹Ğ¼Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞ¹ Ñƒ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ¸ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ¼ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ»ÑÑ

This review will mainly be about the PVE, because the PVP deserves a seperate one. 

If your explanation for these overwhelmingly negative reviews is that we, gamers, are "Toxic", then you are completely missing the point. 

The game is but a shell of what it used to be. The PVE missions are unpolished, have low content, lack any replay-ability, and moreover: It's not even close to what they promised and I'm not only talking about the cancelled Hero mode when I say that.
An amazing well polished coop experience that is challenging, fun, and engaging at the same time? 

That requires you not to abuse your developers/employees. 

You can see the devs had passion and vision, but that doesn't matter anymore nowadays. Because corporate greed and misconduct on the work floor taints everything. 

Missions; 
Cinematic are great, voice acting is great, animations are great, character interactions are great, story is nice. 
Gameplay? Too little of it and that which is there is mediocre.
The AI is dumb and has very little player interaction. Difficulty is inflated by adding more health and damage. That's it. 
Elite enemy? More health, more dmg, still dumb. Play on higher difficulty level? Same thing. Nothing changes. AI doesn't get smarter and interactive, spawns are the same, there's just no love given to it. 
The Event mission has you grab heavy batteries that disable movement abilities and slow you down a ton, they're also quite a bit away from the objective so you have to overextend a bit to get them. However, no enemies get aggrod when you pick them up, there is just one of them you gotta kill in order to obtain it. 
Why not just spawn a wave of enemies so your entire team has to protect the VIP?

I remember in the Archives Storm Rising missions, day 1, when playing on legendary the spawns were actually well thought out and encouraged tactical and cooperative play. But then they reworked the mission on day 2, and that is when well thought out coop was replaced with artificial difficulty inflation. 
Big enemy, big health, big damage, just peak for a few seconds to damage them and repeat infinitely until they die. Braindead gameplay, that invalidated our day 1 victory, as it spawned less enemies too.

These reviews have a bandwagon, yes, but you can't just ignore reality. Gamers are toxic indeed, but that is not a valid argument here. That is not why we are outraged about how Overwatch 2 and 95% of all other AAA games have been soulless money making machines (not you Doom Eternal, Elden Ring and more <3).

I'm sorry devs, you are amazing, it must hurt for you to see all this happen.
I get why Jeff left, I hope he and all others that left are well <3
